shared_text:
The Denim Project
February 9 at 9:00 PM ·

Hey everyone! I have now started a community project; The Denim Project! My love for fashion and clothes sparked an idea that not only uses clothes to help people, but the environment, too! The Denim Project aims to collect denim (jeans, jackets, shorts, skirts, shirts, etc—as long as it’s 90% cotton) and recycle them into home insulation. The Blue Jeans Go Green program has provided this awesome opportunity, and Habitat for Humanity has been involved!
♼
There are donation bins at several locations in the community: Alexandrian Public Library, McKim’s IGA, Bliss Artisan, and Mount Vernon High School! Each bin has the posters from this post. Feel free to donate denim anytime you please to one of these bins!
♼
More information is on the poster (the second picture), but if you have any other questions or concerns don’t hesitate to contact me through Messenger or the contact info on the poster.
♼
I hope to see the community help me recycle denim for a good cause! Instead of pitching an old pair of jeans, donate them to be recycled!!!
